content:
• Monday, August 27, 2012
  • PVH

    More on PVH Corp. (NYSE:PVH): Q2 beats on a per share basis despite flat total sales growth Y/Y....

    More on PVH Corp. (NYSE:PVH): Q2 beats on a per share basis despite flat total sales growth Y/Y. Bottom line margins were boosted by strength in its Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger brands, as well as lower product costs. The company lifted its FY12 guidance, now expecting an EPS of between $6.25 to $6.32. Street estimates are for $6.23 per share. Shares +5.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:08 PM
  • PWRD

    More on Perfect World's Q2: No explanation is given for the weak results, which follow soft...

    More on Perfect World's Q2: No explanation is given for the weak results, which follow soft guidance in May. COO Robert Hong Xiao has been appointed co-CEO; he'll hold the title alongside current chairman/CEO Michael Chi. Perfect World expects Q3 revenue of RMB643M-RMB676M ($100.9M-$106.1M), below a consensus of $120M. Average concurrent users for Chinese games fell by 65K Q/Q to 739K, something Perfect World blames on "anti-cheating efforts." PWRD -8.7% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM
  • ASRT

    Depomed (DEPO) says Janssen Pharmaceuticals has licensed rights to it's Acuform gastric...

    Depomed (DEPO) says Janssen Pharmaceuticals has licensed rights to it's Acuform gastric retentive drug delivery technology. In exchange, DEPO will receive an upfront payment of $10M and a low single-digit royalty on net sales of Nucynta ER in the U.S., Canada and Japan through 2021. Additionally, DEPO will be eligible for a one-time sales milestone after hurdling a specified level of quarterly net sales. Shares +6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • PWRD

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q2 EPS of $0.57 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $106.5M (-11.7% Y/Y)...

    Perfect World (NASDAQ:PWRD): Q2 EPS of $0.57 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $106.5M (-11.7% Y/Y) misses by $1.6M. Shares -5.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM
  • REFR

    Research Frontiers (NASDAQ:REFR) announces a secondary offering with undisclosed terms. The...

    Research Frontiers (NASDAQ:REFR) announces a secondary offering with undisclosed terms. The company intends to use the net proceeds for working capital and general corporate purposes. Shares -2.2% AH, setting a new 52-week low.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM
  • ANGI

    Angie's List (ANGI -7%) gradually sold off to make new post-IPO lows - shares are now down 32%...

    Angie's List (ANGI -7%) gradually sold off to make new post-IPO lows - shares are now down 32% since a lockup expiration ended on Aug. 14. Barrington Research started coverage on the reviews site with a Market Perform. The firm is a fan of Angie's track record, revenue visibility, service differentiation, operating leverage, and potential to raise ad prices, but is worried the company could be "forced into premature profitability" due to cash burn, something that could hinder growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) +5.3% AH after announcing the start-up of operations at its Project Phoenix...

    Molycorp (MCP) +5.3% AH after announcing the start-up of operations at its Project Phoenix facilities at Mountain Pass, Calif., which will produce heavy rare earth concentrate to be processed into high-purity, custom-engineered heavy rare earth products. An on-site combined heat and power plant will begin feeding power and steam this week to the facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 11 Comments
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -6.4%), which had rallied modestly in August following its post-earnings bloodbath,...

    Zynga (ZNGA -6.4%), which had rallied modestly in August following its post-earnings bloodbath, sold off into the close. A recent Bloomberg report detailing new executive defections could be weighing. Eric Bethke, who was in charge of Mafia Wars 2, has disclosed he left this month, and a source claims mobile VP Ya-Bing Chu and GM Jeremy Strauser have also resigned. All of this backs up reports of poor morale and a "flood of resumes" from Zynga developers. (other defections: I, II)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • MNKD

    One possible partner for MannKind (MNKD +9% would be Pfizer (PFE -0.5%), according to a Motley...

    One possible partner for MannKind (MNKD +9% would be Pfizer (PFE -0.5%), according to a Motley Fool article published over the weekend. Not only does MNKD desperately need a partner, but PFE is also in equal need of a new blockbuster drug. So, with MNKD's Afrezza near complete on its clinical trials, the synergies appear, on the surface at least, to be a natural fit.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM | 7 Comments
  • PVH

    Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 EPS of $1.25 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.33B (flat% Y/Y)...

    Phillips-Van Heusen (NYSE:PVH): Q2 EPS of $1.25 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.33B (flat% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • ZLC

    Shares of Zale (ZLC +2.7%) and Blue Nile (NILE +2.5%) get a lift from Tiffany's Q2 results. It's...

    Shares of Zale (ZLC +2.7%) and Blue Nile (NILE +2.5%) get a lift from Tiffany's Q2 results. It's a bit of a curious move as the company's report didn't paint a particularly pretty picture of the sector. On top of that, TIF's jump could be influenced by shorts taking profits off the table as visibility has cleared on the name.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • JKS

    JinkoSolar (JKS +17.5%) shares skyrocket after the solar product maker wins a bid from China...

    JinkoSolar (JKS +17.5%) shares skyrocket after the solar product maker wins a bid from China Guangdong Nuclear Solar Energy Development to supply 30 MW of photovoltaic modules for a photovoltaic power plant project in Hami city, China. The new contract could help JKS recover from an industry-wide decline in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • TIF

    The rally in shares of Tiffany (TIF +8.0%) off of its "triple-miss" keeps chugging right along...

    The rally in shares of Tiffany (TIF +8.0%) off of its "triple-miss" keeps chugging right along as investors jump in with both feet even after the company seemed to set the plate for more slumping sales down the road. Analysts stand convinced that the bar was set so low for the company - that just averting total disaster was good enough to bring in ravenous buyers. NBG's Brian Sozzi notes with an air of caution that the pressure is now on Tiffany to show a robust holiday quarter to keep the good vibe going.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • RHI

    Shares of Robert Half International (RHI -3.7%) slump lower with rumors breaking that research...

    Shares of Robert Half International (RHI -3.7%) slump lower with rumors breaking that research firm Off Wall Street has issued a negative report on the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • TLM

    Talisman Energy (TLM +3.8%) is raised to Outperform at RBC Capital after a series of recent...

    Talisman Energy (TLM +3.8%) is raised to Outperform at RBC Capital after a series of recent events, starting with the sale of its North Sea assets to Sinopec, then a strong Q2 report, and last week's disclosure of two high-profile new shareholders. West Face Capital bought 10.8M shares, or ~1% of the company, and the Ontario Teachers’ Pension upped its 0.5% stake to 1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • UAL

    Airline shares are down marginally today, girding themselves for air travel disruptions as...

    Airline shares are down marginally today, girding themselves for air travel disruptions as Tropical Storm Isaac approaches New Orleans. United (UAL -0.2%) and Southwest LUV -1.2% have already announced plans to cancel flights out of New Orleans on Tuesday and Wednesday. Cancellations will reportedly take effect starting at midnight. DAL DAL -0.3%, AAMRQ.PK -3.2%

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • IMMR

    Haptic feedback technology firm Immersion (IMMR +7.9%) and mobile projector developer...

    Haptic feedback technology firm Immersion (IMMR +7.9%) and mobile projector developer Microvision (MVIS +5.6%) are both up strongly in the absence of news. One possible reason: Investors are betting the Apple-Samsung verdict will lead Android vendors to take a look at Immersion and Microvision's technologies as ways to differentiate themselves.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • SNP

    Sinopec's (SNP +2%) H1 net profit plunged 41%, a much bigger drop than rival PetroChina (PTR...

    Sinopec's (SNP +2%) H1 net profit plunged 41%, a much bigger drop than rival PetroChina (PTR -1.8%), but the results were far above analysts’ expectations. Jefferies finds the report "mysterious," as SNP badly missed Q1 earnings and beat in Q2 despite higher expected refining losses and lower expected upstream earnings; PTR's Q2 results were flat vs. Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • WY

    Weyerhaeuser (WY +1%) gets a bump higher after BMO upped the shares to Market Perform earlier...

    Weyerhaeuser (WY +1%) gets a bump higher after BMO upped the shares to Market Perform earlier today, speculating that surging lumber and panel prices should give a boost to its bottom line and prompt the company to pay out larger cash distributions in 2013 and 2014. Barron's also highlighted the company over the weekend, noting that signs of a housing rebound are likely to lift the shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • VRA

    Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA -5.9%) stumble after the company gets nicked by a price target...

    Shares of Vera Bradley (VRA -5.9%) stumble after the company gets nicked by a price target reduction from Lazard Capital to $34 from $40. The Street has been harsh on the prospects for the company, only last week a note from Wells Fargo called new patterns "uninspiring."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • BMRN

    BioMarin Pharmaceuticals (BMRN -1.8%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche. The firm says...

    BioMarin Pharmaceuticals (BMRN -1.8%) slips on a downgrade to Hold at Deutsche. The firm says much of the good news is baked into the stock, and it sees no compelling risk/reward tradeoff going all the way into Q4.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • MXIM

    Add Maxim Integrated (MXIM -4.1%) to the list of companies affected by Apple-Samsung. The analog...

    Add Maxim Integrated (MXIM -4.1%) to the list of companies affected by Apple-Samsung. The analog chipmaker has decent Samsung exposure, and two of its chips are built into the Galaxy S III. Maxim defends itself by arguing most of its December quarter sales to Samsung will involve newer products such as the S III, which weren't a part of Apple's suit. But that assumes Apple won't seek injunctions on them regardless. Maxim has been rumored to be a supplier for the next iPhone.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM
  • MPC

    Refiners post strong gains as Gulf Coast refineries shut down with Isaac's approach: Marathon...

    Refiners post strong gains as Gulf Coast refineries shut down with Isaac's approach: Marathon (MPC +1.7%) and Phillips 66 (PSX +0.2%) shut two Louisiana refineries with a combined capacity of 711K bbl/day, while Valero (VLO +5.5%) shuts two with a combined 405K bbl/day capacity;Â  Another factor pushing up prices is an explosion that shut operations at Venezuela's Amuay refinery.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -15%) are hit hard today on the back of another...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -15%) are hit hard today on the back of another negative Seeking Alpha article, this time from Chimera Research, claiming that the company's weak finances and disappointing clinical data reported to date on its pipeline drugs give no valid reason to justify its current market cap, much less owning the stock at all at current levels. Last week SA contributor Apsara Biotech had slammed the company, calling the current results for its cancer drug Bavi "overhyped."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 8 Comments
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +15.2%) jumps after announcing the licensing terms under which Novartis...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +15.2%) jumps after announcing the licensing terms under which Novartis (NYSE:NVS) would be able to develop and commercialize CTIC's Pixuvri cancer drug, which was recently approved by the EU. Should Novartis exercise its option on Pixuvri, the drug giant would owe CTIC a $7.5M license fee, up to $104M in milestone payments, and ongoing royalties.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • SVU

    Supervalu (SVU +1.5%) ratchets out another gain as the grocery store operators stays in focus as...

    Supervalu (SVU +1.5%) ratchets out another gain as the grocery store operators stays in focus as a potential target of M&A activity. Short interest in the battered stock has dropped consistently over the last month as a deal to sell itself - either in pieces or in its entirety - seems to be alternately dismissed or hyped by the Street.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 2 Comments
  • EPRS

    Zalicus (ZLCS +11.1%) takes off after announcing the FDA has approved the sale of 32mg tablets...

    Zalicus (ZLCS +11.1%) takes off after announcing the FDA has approved the sale of 32mg tablets for Covidien's (COV +0.6%) Exalgo pain-relief drug. The sale of 8, 12, and 16mg tablets was approved in 2010. Zalicus receives royalties on Exalgo sakes. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • MNKD

    MannKind (MNKD +7.1%) trades higher with more chatter swirling that it will take on a partner to...

    MannKind (MNKD +7.1%) trades higher with more chatter swirling that it will take on a partner to help get it over the hump. Shares touched $2.60 in intra-day trading for the first time since late July.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • SVM

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM +1.6%) reports H1 results of its ongoing underground diamond drilling...

    Silvercorp Metals (SVM +1.6%) reports H1 results of its ongoing underground diamond drilling program at its TLP mine in China. SVM says the program has succeeded in further defining the known mineralization zones as well as extending the major mineralized vein structures downdip and along strike.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 6 Comments
  • LYB

    LyondellBasell (LYB -2.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a price target lowered to $49...

    LyondellBasell (LYB -2.2%) is downgraded to Neutral from Buy with a price target lowered to $49 from $51 by UBS, which believes shares may weaken later this year due to increased feedstock costs. In Q2, LYB enjoyed outstanding margins due to a combination of factors that resulted in bargain ethane prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical (WLK -2.6%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral at UBS, which says the current...

    Westlake Chemical (WLK -2.6%) is downgraded to Sell from Neutral at UBS, which says the current stock near $69 has been buoyed in the near-term by an unusual combination of factors that will moderate starting later in 2012. The firm believes the advantageous confluence of factors will ease by Q4 and ethane prices will rise.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM | 1 Comment
  • CSOD

    Not surprisingly, Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +7.5%) is rallying after IBM-Kenexa fuels new hopes...

    Not surprisingly, Cornerstone OnDemand (CSOD +7.5%) is rallying after IBM-Kenexa fuels new hopes that the company will be bought out by a larger enterprise software name. Also trading higher are peers Saba Software (OTCPK:SABA +10.6%) and Ultimate Software (ULTI +2.5%).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG -4.2%) is one patent name that's actually selling off today. A critical article...

    Vringo (VRNG -4.2%) is one patent name that's actually selling off today. A critical article from SA's Modernist could be the reason why. The column notes Google might be able to get Vringo's lawsuit dismissed through a summary judgment that cites prior art. That would prevent the suit from being handled by a potentially sympathetic jury. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:07 AM | 4 Comments
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY +5.1%) jump higher after the company announces it reached an agreement...

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY +5.1%) jump higher after the company announces it reached an agreement with Richard Schulze over due diligence. The ex-founder also landed official permission from Best Buy to form an investment group.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • MTB

    More on the M&T/Hudson City deal: There isn't much action in other regional bank shares as...

    More on the M&T/Hudson City deal: There isn't much action in other regional bank shares as M&T (MTB +4.8%) - by the market's verdict - picks itself up a steal, buying Hudson City (HCBK +16.2%) at about 80% of tangible book value. Hudson City finds itself in this vulnerable position by recent costly balance sheet restructurings and continuing barely-visible net interest margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • SRPT

    Sarepta (NASDAQ:SRPT) +11.5% to $12.02 after a positive weekend article in Barrons about the...

    Sarepta (NASDAQ:SRPT) +11.5% to $12.02 after a positive weekend article in Barrons about the company's Eteplirsen treatment for Duchenne muscular dystrophy, which could receive expedited approval from the FDA if its Phase IIb trials are as strong as earlier studies. One analyst has a price target of $16 and reckons peak sales could hit $600M; however, writing on The Street, Nathan Sadeghi-Nejad remains cautious.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL -11.5%) gets crushed thanks to Apple-Samsung. Samsung is PANL's largest...

    Universal Display (PANL -11.5%) gets crushed thanks to Apple-Samsung. Samsung is PANL's largest customer: the company relies on PANL's materials to make the OLED displays that go into most of its top Android phones, and also pays fixed licensing fees.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 6 Comments
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar (NYSE:NAV) continue to heat up off of word that Lewis Campbell will replace...

    Shares of Navistar (NYSE:NAV) continue to heat up off of word that Lewis Campbell will replace Daniel Ustain immediately, and now stand up 7.8%. As part of his deal, Campbell landed 500K stock options on Navistar's common stock. Quick reaction from the Street on the CEO swap is positive, although Wells Fargo warns a return to profitability for Navistar is still a major challenge as the firm keeps a Market Perform rating locked in place.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:33 AM | 3 Comments
  • KEG

    Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +3.8% premarket after Sun Trust upgrades shares to Buy from...

    Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) +3.8% premarket after Sun Trust upgrades shares to Buy from Neutral with a $12 target price based on strong oil prices and improved margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • IBM

    IBM is buying cloud HR software vendor Kenexa (KNXA) for $1.3B, or $46/share. The price...

    IBM is buying cloud HR software vendor Kenexa (KNXA) for $1.3B, or $46/share. The price represents a 42% premium to Kenexa's Friday close. The acquisition follows SAP and Oracle's purchases of peers SuccessFactors and Taleo, and comes as Workday, another big name in the space, prepares an IPO. Cornerstone OnDemand (NASDAQ:CSOD), a cloud HR name that hasn't found a buyer yet, could trade higher on the news. IBM expects the acquisition to close in Q4. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: Nasdaq futures are +0.7% and lead the charge higher following Apple's (+2.45%)...

    Market preview: Nasdaq futures are +0.7% and lead the charge higher following Apple's (+2.45%) $1.05B patent win against Samsung (-7.45% in Seoul). The S&P Benchmark is +0.35% and the Dow straggles behind almost unchanged. Nokia (+9.7%) and RIM (+5.6%) benefit nicely, while Microsoft climbs a more stately 1.15% and Google falls 1.9%. Hertz roars 15.4% after it finally snags Dollar Thrifty (+7.4%). Later: Dallas Fed Manufacturing Outlook
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • IDIX

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) -15.8% premarket after receiving verbal notice from the FDA...

    Idenix Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:IDIX) -15.8% premarket after receiving verbal notice from the FDA that a clinical hold has been placed on IDX19368, IDIX's next-generation nucleotide polymerase inhibitor under development for the treatment of hepatitis C virus infection.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • IBM

    Premarket gainers: KNXA +41%. ZLCS +23%. HTZ +16%. HCBK +14%. IMGN +13%. NOK +9%. SRPT +8%. DTG...

    Premarket gainers: KNXA +41%. ZLCS +23%. HTZ +16%. HCBK +14%. IMGN +13%. NOK +9%. SRPT +8%. DTG +7%. NAV +7%. MTSL +7%. TIF +6%. RIMM +5%. CAR +5%.
    Losers: IDIX -17%. VRNG -6%. PPHM -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • IDCC

    A couple more patent names moving thanks to Apple-Samsung: IDCC +5.3%. VHC +1.8%. Also,...

    A couple more patent names moving thanks to Apple-Samsung: IDCC +5.3%. VHC +1.8%. Also, iPhone/iPad audio codec supplier Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) is up 2.4%. Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) official response to the verdict is cautious: the company merely asserts most of Apple's patent claims "don't relate to the core Android operating system, and several are being re-examined" by the USPTO; and that everyone in the industry is "building upon ideas that have been around for decades."
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 2 Comments
  • HCBK

    Hudson City Bancorp (NASDAQ:HCBK) shares come off their trading halt, +13% following the merger...

    Hudson City Bancorp (NASDAQ:HCBK) shares come off their trading halt, +13% following the merger announcement with M&T Bank. MTB shares +1.3%, suggesting an even better price for Hudson City shareholders in the all-stock deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • NAV

    Navistar's (NAV +6.8%) Daniel Ustian retires as Chairman, President and CEO, effective...

    Navistar's (NAV +6.8%) Daniel Ustian retires as Chairman, President and CEO, effective immediately, and is being replaced as Chairman by former Textron CEO and GM veteran Lewis Campbell, who is also becoming interim CEO until the company appoints a replacement. Ustian's departure comes as Navistar goes through a tough time and considers job cuts. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:50 AM | 1 Comment
  • SDRL

    More on Seadrill's (NYSE:SDRL) Q2: Higher operating expenses masked strong revenue gains....

    More on Seadrill's (NYSE:SDRL) Q2: Higher operating expenses masked strong revenue gains. Operating profit for floaters, SDRL's largest segment, rose 1.2% to $345M, jack-up rigs reported a 20% rise, while tender rigs posted $78M in profit (95% increase). SDRL says it expects to continue to show solid growth in Q3. Shares +1.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
  • OESX

    Orion Energy (NYSEMKT:OESX) -3% premarket after disclosing receipt of an SEC subpoena requesting...

    Orion Energy (NYSEMKT:OESX) -3% premarket after disclosing receipt of an SEC subpoena requesting documents related to its financial reporting of solar photovoltaic systems sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:29 AM
  • TIF

    It's early in the day, but shares of Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) are up a puzzling 8.1% premarket off of...

    It's early in the day, but shares of Tiffany (NYSE:TIF) are up a puzzling 8.1% premarket off of the company's triple miss (I, II) in Q2. Hedgeye Retail suggests the firm's two-year comps in Asia could be behind the boost, while a defense from Oppenheimer is also in play.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:27 AM
  • RHHBY

    Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY)  breast cancer drug T-DM1 "significantly" extended the lives of...

    Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY)Â  breast cancer drug T-DM1 "significantly" extended the lives of patients in a Phase III trial, a precondition for European regulators approving the treatment. Roche is developing T-DM1 with technology it has licensed from ImmunoGen (NASDAQ:IMGN), which is rocketing 17.05% premarket. An analyst estimates that peak sales of T-DM1 could reach 1.6B Swiss francs ($1.67B). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • AAPL

    Investors continue to bid up Apple following its big court victory over Samsung. AAPL +2.4% to a...

    Investors continue to bid up Apple following its big court victory over Samsung. AAPL +2.4% to a record $679 premarket. GOOG -1.4%, MSFT +1%, NOK +11.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:35 AM | 31 Comments
  • NOK

    EU shares open mixed ahead of the German Ifo index of business sentiment today, and, more...

    EU shares open mixed ahead of the German Ifo index of business sentiment today, and, more significantly, Jackson Hole at the end of the week. Euro STOXX 50 -0.2%, Paris -0.3%, Frankfurt -0.2%, Madrid flat, Milan +0.2%, London closed. Nokia (NYSE:NOK) +9% in Helsinki following Samsung's massive patent loss against Apple.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian shares are mixed as investors mark time ahead of the central bankers' get together at...

    Asian shares are mixed as investors mark time ahead of the central bankers' get together at Jackson Hole at the weekend. Japan +0.2%, Hong Kong -0.4%, China -1.3%, India -0.1%. South Korea -1.9%, Samsung -7.45%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 AM
  • SSNLF

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is down 6.9% in Seoul after losing big to Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). Much of...

    Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) is down 6.9% in Seoul after losing big to Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL). Much of Samsung's $4.5B Q2 net profit was tied to smartphone sales, hence the risk of U.S. injunctions and less competitive products is being taken seriously. Still, some think Android (NASDAQ:GOOG) can remain competitive even if it can't use the software patents Samsung was declared to infringe, and others see Apple's efforts to portray Samsung products as Apple clones giving Samsung a marketing boost.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 AM | 7 Comments
